column1: 177. When  a  person  charged  with  one  offence  may  be  convicted  of  a  different
If in the case mentioned in section 176 the accused is charged with one offence and it
appears in evidence that he committed a different offence for which he might
have been charged under the provisions of that section, he may be convicted of
the offence which he is shown to have committed although he was not charged
